headline: Fresh Tomato Soup
description: This simple, quick and easy recipe for homemade fresh tomato soup is perfect to make when tomatoes are ripe in gardens and farmers' markets.

video.description: In this video, learn how to make tomato soup from scratch for the ultimate comfort food. This simple tomato soup recipe uses fresh tomatoes and will remind you of your mom's famous cooking.
video.name: Fresh Tomato Soup Recipe

name: Fresh Tomato Soup
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a stockpot, over medium heat, combine the tomatoes, large slice of onion, garlic cloves, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, and gently boil for about 20 minutes to blend all of the flavors.
Remove from heat and run the mixture through a food mill into a large bowl, or pan. Discard any stuff left over in the food mill.
In the now empty stockpot, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the flour to make a roux, cooking until the roux is a medium brown.
Gradually whisk in a bit of the tomato mixture, so that no lumps form, then stir in the rest.
Season with sugar and salt, and adjust to taste.

review.reviewBody: I made this recipe, but instead of using cloves as shown in the photos, I used garlic cloves. Did anyone else use cloves? That would have been strange. Dont leave out the sugar and a bit of cream or yoghurt is good.
Easy to follow and really tasty.
I used canned tomatoes that I canned in summer. This was so raw: RAW tomatoes, gariic, onion, cooked it down twice as long and it still tasted raw.
This is a quick,easy, and delicious. A few small changes... added 2 Tbs. tomato paste, 1 tsp. dried basil, a pinch of dill, and a pinch of cayenne pepper. I personally just like a little more spice.

This recipe was simple and easy to make for a work night dinner of soup and sandwiches. I have a freezer full of roasted tomatoes that I have been trying to use up and this recipe was perfect. I used a food mill to remove the seeds and skins from the tomatoes for a smooth texture and used Better Than Bouillon instead of broth because my heirloom tomatoes were so juicy they didn‚Äôt need more liquid. I added the garlic plus fresh chopped basil at the end for a spicier flavor. The herbs and tomato flavor was amazing. My husband used it like tomato sauce for his chicken Parmesan and even had seconds! It‚Äôs a keeper.
Mmm, I liked it. I didn't add the sugar or salt though.

I have used this recipe, and others that are similar. There are a couple of easy ways to make it better. Tomato seeds are bitter, so take a minute to scoop them from the cut fruit. I almost always take time to roast my tomatoes first, and will often make it with a roasted red pepper. I just burn the pepper on my gas stove until it is black, toss the pepper in a plastic bag when it is hot and let it cool. Wash off the black and you have a fresh roasted pepper. If you want a bit of heat, I also roast and freeze jalape√±os and grate a little into the soup. I know there are purists and that is terrific for you. Others will make changes to fit their own tastes. This is a great base recipe that can be personalized easily. For example, I can't use salt, so I use garlic and other herbs in its place. I will sometimes use roasted sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds it in to add body and make it thicker. I could eat this every day, and think I will have it for lunch today. Thanks for the recipe.

This was incredibly simple to prepare, (but time consuming to strain), tasted delightful, and a great way to use up an abundance of end-of-season tomatoes. I froze leftovers in an oversized muffin tin for later. The only change I will make upon preparing this the next time is the salt. I will hold off adding until I've had a chance to taste; the 1 tsp made the soup too salty.
Awesome soup my husband and son are not soup fans and both got seconds. Making a triple batch tonight with my garden tomatoes and garden onions so I can freeze some.
Good soup and easy, quick!

EXCELLENT!! I had garden tomatoes needing attention and had already made salsa many times, so was ready for something different. Plus, feeling croupy today this was the best!! Not having a food processor or immersion tool, good old fashion improvising is the name of the game. Being an old cook for years, I added cilantro to the original recipe and will keep this over the one I made in the past. Thanks for sharing!
easy but not as good
Followed the recipe exactly and it turned out to be the best tomato soup I've ever had. I am so grateful to have discovered this recipe. Thank you!!

Wow! This is so easy to prepare and so tasty! I used up the last of the tomatoes in the garden, and added 1 pint of canned tomatoes. This recipe is definitely a keeper. Great for a cool blustery day like today on Lake Erie.
So yummy! I used a Ninja blender as the food mill and added a few sprinkles of crushed red pepper for a little kick.

I really love this recipe as it was originally submitted with the 4 spice cloves (reason for 4 not 5 stars). Additionally, it is a great base if you want add a can of Rotel, or basil, or whatever else suits your fancy. Everyone had a bumper crop of tomatoes this year and I've made 7 + batches of the original recipe of this soup in the last 30 days. The last three batches I froze. My one recommendation is to make the soup a few hours ahead if you can; it is absolutely delicious when the flavors have settled in.... Thank you for a great recipe!

This is a really great base for a lovely tomato soup. I sis first skin and core the tomatoes & I like to saute the onions & less garlic first & a pinch of nutmeg, Adding heavy cream at the fini is also YUM. Used emersion blender & strained (opt)

Delicious!!! Have made this several times, a double batch today to freeze. I did notice that clove has been eliminated, garlic added. I did add a couple teaspoons of the clove in addition to the garlic. The clove adds such a lovely warm, nutty flavor. Thank you so much for this recipe! I love it!

Oh my gosh, delicious!! Used red and orange tomatoes, rye flour. Eliminated sugar. Added fresh basil just before serving. 4 cloves of garlic...well, since I had smaller beads, I did put more in, addiction of mine. Definitely a keeper recipe, thank you!
Soooo simple and sooooo good! I added some fresh basil and rosemary. We always have home made roux in the fridge. That makes this even easier.
I used an immersion blender to mix in the tomatoes and onions and it worked great!

The thought of sifting out the ingredients in a food mill seemed wasteful so, I poured everything into a blender instead. To thicken the mixture I added two tablespoons of tomato paste to the roux, added maple syrup to taste instead of white sugar, and finally 2 tsp of basil. I‚Äôm convinced that using a blender to make this soup tastes better and is healthier than using a food mill.
Simple and flavorful soup. Nice and quick to make and I can use up all my little tomatoes without having to skin them.
Oh my gosh! I made this and so good! I did change the chicken broth to vegetable broth as that I had. I will definitely be making this again.
My family loves this soup! Followed recipe verbatim. Thanks so much. This is my 5th or 6th batch this growing season. So good!

This was easy and delicious. I did but have cloves, so I used garlic. It is a smooth, creamy soup when strained. I have to do that due to dietary restrictions, but otherwise it would not be necessary.
I added some garlic , basil , and thyme . Perfect !!

Very good. I used garlic cloves, not the spice clove, and sliced a medium onion. I also skinned and seeded the tomatoes, it's just my preference, but not necessary. This is a classic tomato soup. I will give some out and mention people could personalize it with the addition of milk, or herbs (basil comes to mind), or croutons, whatever you like in tomato soup.
Pretty simple, nice fresh taste.

I followed this soup recipe as written and as others mentioned I wasn‚Äôt disappointed. Amazingly simple and delicious. Another great way to use up garden tomatoes. Used my blender as no food mill with preskinned tomatoes. Thanks!

Excellent soup, easy to make. Freezes well. I'm about to make another batch. Thanks for the post. The soup shown in the video that accompanies this recipe is far thicker than the recipe will produce. The recipe is perfect as is. Try it first THEN adjust for your preferences.

I added some celery to the initial mixture. I cut the salt and sugar in 1/2 for health reasons. I added a splash of basil. Just before eating, I added a Few dashes of Parmesan cheese to my bowl. My husband said, ‚ÄúSave that recipe!‚Äù

This soup is magical if you have garden tomatoes going spare. I like to add a bit of Garlic and a whole onion (it says slice here for some reason). I finish with a dollop of fresh garden pesto in each bowl (very herby version) and top with grated fresh parmesan. Grab some crusty roles (and butter of course) and eat away. Delicious!

We were canning sauce and just pulled out 4 cups of the juice and made the soup following all the recipe. Since we had run the juice thru a food mill, we didn‚Äôt have to run it thru after boiling. Added one diced up tomato at the end for some texture. Excellent.

I made this soup from scratch.. It is so easy and delicious. I used fresh crush garlic and also added 1/2 tsp. of oregano and added 2 Tlbs. grated Italian Cheese. The second batch I made, I ran out of full amount of Chicken broth, so made up the difference by finishing it off with half and half. Also delicious. We ate half of each batch, then froze the other half in our freezer. Well yesterday, I took out my home made stuff peppers and decided to use the fresh tomato soup in it to bake instead of opening a can of tomato sauce.. Thanks for sharing this recipe. Marie S.
I am allergic to cloves so we used garlic. Really good. So good we canned some for quick winter use. Can't wait to see if it held up in processing.
First time I made homemade tomato soup. Very good and surprisingly easy. Definitely will be a staple on my menu from now on.

I'm wondering why so many people gave this a 5-star rating. It's okay, but there is nothing good or bad about it. Just very meh. It needs some oomph - maybe garlic, parmesan, cream, something. I'm glad that I made my own seasoned croutons and added those.
Sooooo good!!! That‚Äôs all I have to say. I‚Äôve made it twice now. The first time using brandywine tomatoes the second time using Roma tomatoes. They were both fantastic!
The best homemade tomato soup ever!!!

This is the fourth time I am typing my review. It keeps disappearing before I finish. If it doesn't work this time, I give up! I made this recipe several times, each time making larger amounts. Yesterday, I made 12 quarts. My intent was to pressure can this soup for future use. When I did some research to find out if I would have to add acid to each jar, and if this would change the taste, I learned some interesting facts. Because I used flour for the slurry to thicken the soup, flour is an ingredient that cannot be safely canned, even in a pressure canner. Also, I would have needed acid to keep the level high enough for the soup to be shelf stable, but you don't want the acid level to affect the soup. So after reading this, I guess I have no choice than to freeze most of my soup. I prefer canning because of the convenience. I don't like having to remember to take it out of the freezer for when I think I want to eat it. So in the future, I guess I will follow the recipe omitting the slurry, salt, and sugar. Then just add the acid and salt to each jar before processing it. If anyone out there has processed this recipe like I mentioned in the above paragraph, please let me know if it works, and is shelf stable for a good amount of time. Thank you for reading and perhaps commenting. Again, this recipe is DELICIOUS!! Marsha

I know it isn‚Äôt the original recipe if you change anything but, I added a tiny bit more salt and a couple of jalape√±os. Fresh tomato soup with s little spice is fantastic. Thank you for this great recipe!
Great soup recipe! I had a ton of fresh tomatoes from the garden. I would peal the tomatoes skins next time but other than that it came out excellent. Plus I had the yellow low acidic tomatoes.
I just pureed after boiling, followed the rest of the instructions and WOW!!! home grown tomatoesüëçüëç oh and I added a little basil

Most delicious tomato soup!!! Only modifications I did was to put the cloves, 1 garlic clove (cut in half) and 4 fresh basil leaves in a sachet, so it was easy to remove after the tomatoes and 2 slices of onions had simmered for the 20 minutes. I also removed most of the onions before using the immersion blender. I used a mix of Amana, Mennonite orange, Black Crim and Rainbow (red) tomatoes all fresh from the garden! Sooooo yummy, definitely saving this recipe!!
Best. Tomato. Soup. Ever.

I am blown away by this simple recipe. Absolutely delicious as written. Only fault is this made 3 coffee mug servings not 6 as stated maybe because I didn't have any tomato chunks. Watch the video - very helpful. I have an immersion blender and then poured this mix through a colander over a heat resistant bowl pressing with the back of a wooden spoon until it all dripped through. Perfect and will make again as this uses up my surplus ripe tomatoes. Thank you for this recipe.
Very easy and tasty. Excellent for people who is on a liquid diet.

I don't usually rate these but I was pretty disappointed to find I only had one large bowl of soup when all was said and done. Unless the serving size is 1/3 cup, there are NOT 6 servings in this recipe. I thought a few of us would sit down to warm bowls of soup and crackers. We didn't.

I thought it was a great way to use up tomatoes. It was easy and quick. I read one reviewer's response to people changing the recipe and adding things that's not in there. Saying you shoukd stick to the recipe. Well not all people have the same tastes. The only thing I added was some basil but I think the recipe is a really good base to experiment with adding different things to your taste.

What did I do wrong? I blanched the tomatoes, they are a little larger than ping pong balls. Removed the skins. Came up with 4 cups of tomatoes and ran them and the onion through a sieve. Should I have measured the tomatoes AFTER sieving them. Followed the recipe exactly. My soup is bland and watery. The leftover soup in the refrigerator has separated into a half inch of ? above the tomato soup. Advice? OK, I just finally watched the video. The printed recipe says 1 slice onion. Obviously it should say 1 SLICED onion, not 1 slice. First mistake. I hope I can figure out something to make my leftover soup taste better.....
delicious!!!!!
First time I made it. Loved it , but I need to make more next time. Remember you can always put things in it , but can't take it out. Just saying.
Wow! Never tasted fresh tomato soup that was so good. Talk about easy too. Of course, you gotta start with great farmer's market fresh tomatoes.

My second time making this soup. And i should say I followed this recipe per the description and the blog using garlic and cloves and it is amazing. But im sorry i don't make any soup of any sort without bay leaves their flavor is amazingly awesome. I don't have a mill, i used a blender and then put an metal mesh stainer over a bowl to filter it and used a wooden spoon to stir it around and the seed where in the strainer and soup was in the bowl.
the best tomato soup I have ever made. added 2 cloves of garlic and lots of fresh basil as my husband is a big tomato basil soup
I modified with a few tomato pieces, chopped fine, for texture.
The recipe was very good.I used heirloom tomatoes from my garden. Kept some of the onion chunks in the tomato liquid and used an immersion blender. Served with Ritz crackers. No sugar needed.
I've always eaten Campbell's tomato soup. It is the only brand I have consistently eaten. I will now say if I have tomatoes I will be eating this. Quick, easy, and delicious.
I made it using basil and garlic. It is wonderful. Plan to make it many times!

I thought it was absolutely delicious! My husband loved it too! It is a keeper; plan to cook this often and would not change a thing! Glad I have an immersion blender which made it super easy! Thank you!

Made without any changes ( other than I didn‚Äôt have a food milk, so I peeled tomatoes, then chopped and cooked as written. After the 20 minutes I removed the onions then blended tomatoes till smooth. Did the rest as written in recipe. Will definitely make again and again with my garden tomatoes.

Great way to use up a bumper tomato crop. It had a tad too much salt for my taste so I will add less next time. I did add a basil sprig to the pot and let It cook with the other ingredients. I removed it prior to using my immersion blender. I did use garlic cloves instead of spice cloves. The way I read the paragraph "how to make tomato soup" it does specify whole garlic cloves. The other may be tasty as well but I chose to go with garlic.

Sorry, purists, I made these small changes: 1) I didn't have whole cloves so sprinkled in the powdered kind. 2) I don't mind skins and seeds, so I chopped the tomatoes fairly small and didn't strain the mixture at all. 3) "To taste" for me was just a pinch of sugar. But six servings?! Ha, I devoured the whole batch myself in about ten minutes. Delicious!
Excellent soup! Made exactly as recipe written and it came out so good! Was wondering how much onion because the recipe states 1 slice? I chopped a whole small onion. It was delish!
Don't change a thing in this recipe, it's perfect, basic, and easy to prepare just as written. Save the residual tomato sauce and use in other recipes.
Pretty good soup. Easy.
made this last year added a little garlic because I misinterpeted cloves for cloves of garlic. added garlic with the cloves and all turned out well. Everyone that received a jar loved it.
Can i can this soup?

I actually haven't made this soup as written because I feel the recipe is written wrong. I believe the "cloves" should have been written "CLOVES OF GARLIC". I made the recipe with that change, and it was simple and delicious!
Cloves add a richness and depth of flavor. Instead of a blender, I use an emersion blender right in the pan -- best tool ever!

Very simple to make, and very tasty. My son is vegan, so I use vegetable stock in place of the chicken broth, and it is wonderful. I was a bit shy on tomatoes with my last batch, so I tossed in diced red and orange bell pepper and it turned out Amazing.
The perfect time to make it since the best fresh tomatoes are in season now. Red & sweet. Also fresh basil. I add cream before serving to cut down on the acid. Delish with a grilled cheese sandwich.

Well the soup wells. Side dish additive is for myself; Veggies that is purchased at the local grocery store and seasoned tortilla chips or crutons. Do you have a replacement for cloves in green herb form?
I thought it was delicious. It was the best tomato soup I have had and will definitely be making again.

I've been looking for a basic tomato soup recipe, and this is a great tutorial. We didn't care for the taste of cloves, so I will omit that the next time; that's just a difference in taste preference. I don't have a food mill, so I ran it through the blender before placing in a sieve to get the seeds out. We thought that the texture was perfect. I did add some garlic powder and black pepper, along with the salt and sugar. We have a lot of small tomatoes, and this was a great way to use them. I'll definitely do this again, just change up the spices a bit.
its so fun and easy
Very yummy! I just have to work on not making chunks with the flour and butter mixture. Lol

Delicious! I doubled the recipe and the first night I did not run thru sieve second night I did. Mad e home made grilled cheese sandwiches with the soup. Used my husband's organic home grown tomatoes. Trying to use them u!!!!!
loved the soup! i added some fresh basil in at the end since i saw it in the tips, tasted alot better when i added the basil!
Yummy üòã
Recipe was terrific. Followed it using all ingredients, NO substitutions. Recommend to tomato lovers. Used a good mill as well.

I was thinking about throwing out a load of tomatoes I got from the neighbor before coming across this recipe. I had no idea what to do with all the tomatoes had. This was perfect and everyone in my household loves it.
I added about 1/4 top of homemade dried chilli flakes.

I just made this for my family and let me tell you........it is SIMPLY AMAZING!!!!! I wanted to give it a fair trial, so I followed the recipe to the letter with 2 exceptions: I added the salt and sugar in small batches, testing after each addition. For our taste, it only needed half the salt and sugar the recipe called for. I used salted butter (all I had) to make the roux, which could account for it. I also added a little black pepper at the end because that's how my kids like it! I can honestly say that I have no intention of EVER buying canned tomato soup again!!! P.S. The cloves set it off beautifully!!

I had a bad cold and was craving grilled cheese with tomato soup but didn‚Äôt feel like cooking a lot. This recipe for soup is AMAZING. T he best tomato soup I‚Äôd ever had. I added a bit of cilantro, animator powder for color and a spoon of tomato paste. But overall I followed the recipe. I wished I‚Äôd made more. It turned out delicious.
We love this recipe just the way it is. So tasty and easy to make!
Super tasty and super easy recipe.

LOVE this soup - one of my favorites because it's so fast, easy and delicious. It truly is perfect any time of the year. As far as the clove question goes, I use both garlic cloves (freshly minced) AND powdered cloves. Also, the fresh basil is definitely amazing - I don't always have it in the house, but when I do: Mmm-mmm good! My only change: I add a bay leaf to give it that extra something-something.
I have made this soup many times since I found the recipe last spring. It is so delicious! I added a clove of garlic because I like garlic. Everyone who has had it lo es it too! It's a winner!
This makes great soup. I‚Äôve made a few times. One time there might have been a bit too much clove. I sometimes like to throw in veggies I know I need to use to help out flavor.

This recipe was terrible. It turned out like paste and I had to add milk and more chicken broth to make it into soup consistency. All I wanted was to make some tomato soup for my daughter to have with her cheese sandwich. I would have given 2 stars but the system said error.
Good soup!
Wonderful tasting.
I like it just as it is.

YUM! Made using exact ingredients listed, but followed the steps in the video which makes this a very easy soup. I used cloves (spice, not garlic) because that's what the video shows. Can easily be adjusted using your favourite flavours.

I made as is except no milk or cream. Added basil . The recipes great as is. I just had so much basil and I love the flavor it adds so I added it. Makes all those extra home grown tomatoes worth it. Thanks for the great recipe. 

Just make as is. A few extra spices to your taste if you chose. Respect the cook and her recipe!

I followed the recipe except, I didn‚Äôt remove skin or seeds and let my immersion blender take care of it. A delicious creamy soup that I found to be a bit too salty as written . I will reduce the salt next time as there definitely will be one. It‚Äôs harvest time!
So easy to make and is delicious. I have made it several times already. I have not experimented with other tomato soup recipes, and do not feel the need to do so.
